metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2924 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The receive_ra function in rdisc/nm-lndp-rdisc.c in the Neighbor Discovery(ND) protocol implementation in the IPv6 stack in NetworkManager 1.x allowsremote attackers to reconfigure a hop-limit setting via a small hop_limitvalue in a Router Advertisement (RA) message, a similar issue toCVE-2015-2922.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu5
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu5
libnm-glib4 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu5
libnm-util2 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu5
libnm0 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu5
network-manager - 1.0.4-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: network-manager package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.4-0ubuntu5').
